titleStmt.title: The last vvill and testament of the Marquis d'Ancre Together with his araignment. His obsequies. His wifes teares on his death. The re-union of the King with his men of warre. The rousing of the soldat françois. All declaring the diuine iudgement of God on the death of the said Marshall d'Ancre. Out of the French copies printed at Paris and Roan.
Testament et dernière volonté de sieur Conchini de Conchino. English.
titleStmt.author: Concini, Concino, maréchal d'Ancre, ca. 1575-1617, attributed name.
Galigaï, Léonora, ca. 1571-1617.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Felix Kyngston for William Arondell, at the Angell in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Not in fact by the Marquess d'Ancre, but an attack on him.
A translation of: Le testament et dernière volonté de sieur Conchini de Conchino.

Contents: general title page followed by (1:) "The diuine iudgement of God in the death of the Marquis d'Ancre" (caption title), 8 p.; (2:) "The last vvill and testament of Sr. Conchini de Conchino", [2], 7 [i.e. 8] p. (p. 8 misnumbered 7); (3:) "The arraignment of the Marques d'Ancre", [2], 8, [2] p. (last leaf blank); (4:) "The funerall obsequies and buriall of Conchini Marshall d'Ancre", [2], 5, [1] p.; (5:) "The teares of the Marshall d'Ancres wife, shed for the death of her husband", [2], 6 p.; (6:) "The rousing of the soldat francois", [2], 5, [1] p.; (7:) The reunion of the King with his men of war, [2] p., with text commencing "The same day the Marquesse d'Ancre was slaine ..". Sections 2-6 each have separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous.
Parts 3,4, and 5 identified as STC 5616, 5619, and 5623 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
